Standard variant is a variant where the first player can place a stone anywhere on the board.
Swap variant is a variant where the first player can place a stone anywhere on the board, but the second player can swap the position of the first two stones.

Renju variant is a variant where the first player can place a stone anywhere on the board, but the second player can swap the position of the first two stones. The first player can not make a move that would result in a three in a row.

Omok variant is a variant where the first player can place a stone anywhere on the board, but the second player can swap the position of the first two stones. The first player can not make a move that would result in a three in a row. The second player can not make a move that would result in a four in a row.

Pente variant is a variant where the first player can place a stone anywhere on the board, but the second player can swap the position of the first two stones. The first player can not make a move that would result in a three in a row. The second player can not make a move that would result in a four in a row. The first player can capture two stones in a row by placing a stone on the other side of the two stones.

Caro variant is a variant where the first player can place a stone anywhere on the board, but the second player can swap the position of the first two stones. The first player can not make a move that would result in a three in a row. The second player can not make a move that would result in a four in a row. The first player can capture two stones in a row by placing a stone on the other side of the two stones. The second player can capture two stones in a row by placing a stone on the other side of the two stones. The first player can capture three stones in a row by placing a stone on the other side of the three stones.

Ninuki Renju variant is a variant where the first player can place a stone anywhere on the board, but the second player can swap the position of the first two stones. The first player can not make a move that would result in a three in a row. The second player can not make a move that would result in a four in a row. The first player can capture two stones in a row by placing a stone on the other side of the two stones. The second player can capture two stones in a row by placing a stone on the other side of the two stones. The first player can capture three stones in a row by placing a stone on the other side of the three stones. The second player can not make a move that would result in a three in a row.
